title: The East Africa Law Society (EALS) Training for Public Interest Lawyers on Digital Rights in Sub Saharan Africa (Fully Funded to Nairobi, Kenya)
subtitle: Programme de formation entièrement financé pour les avocats du droit public spécialisé dans les droits numériques en Afrique subsaharienne.
description: L'East Africa Law Society (EALS) offre une formation régionale pour les avocats défendant les droits humains, l'espace civique et les libertés numériques.  Le programme se tiendra à Nairobi, Kenya, du 21 au 22 août 2025.
content: 4.3KApplication Deadline: July 28, 2025Applications are now open for theEast Africa Law Society (EALS) Training for Public Interest Lawyers on Digital Rights.The East Africa Law Society (EALS), through the EALS Institute and in partnership with the International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL), is proud to offer a fully funded regional training program designed specifically for lawyers defending human rights, civic space, and digital freedoms across Africa.This unique, immersive program convenes legal practitioners from across Sub Saharan Africa tosharpen practical skills, foster strategic regional collaboration, and address emerging legal challengesin the digital realm. Participants will benefit from expert instruction, dynamic peer exchange, andongoing support to champion digital rights effectively in their jurisdictions and beyond.RequirementsThe East Africa Law Society (EALS) invite public interest lawyers from across all of Sub-Saharan Africa to apply, particularly those who:Are actively engaged in human rights litigation, digital rights advocacy, or defending civic spaceDemonstrate a strong commitment to using legal tools to advance digital freedomsAre eager to engage in regional cooperation and exchange knowledge with peers from acrossthe continentApplications from lawyers operating in contexts experiencing increased digital repression areespecially encouraged.Program HighlightThis interactive and impact-focused training delivers:Contextualized Legal CurriculumTailored modules shaped by a pre-training needs assessment and reflective of diverse national and regional realities.Expert-Led SessionsInsights and guidance from renowned digital rights scholars, seasoned litigators, and leading practitioners across Africa and internationally.Practical Skill-BuildingHands-on workshops, simulations, and exercises designed to translate theory into effective legal action.Professional AccreditationEarn 2 Continuous Professional Development (CPD) points accredited by national bar associations for EALS members.Strategic NetworkingAccess a vibrant, interdisciplinary legal cluster within the Digital Rights Alliance Africa (DRAA) to exchange knowledge and coordinate advocacy efforts.Action-Oriented OutcomesDevelop concrete post-training action plans to implement learning in your work.Sustained Mentorship and CollaborationContinued access to a virtual legal collaboration platform for case sharing, peer learning, and mentorship support.Training DetailsDates: August 21st – 22nd, 2025Location: Nairobi, KenyaCosts: All travel, accommodation, meals, and training materials will be fully funded for selected participants.NOTE: French and English translations will be providedHow to ApplyPlease complete the online application form by Tuesday, July 28th, 2025, at 4:00 PMEast Africa Time.Your application should include the following:Curriculum Vitae (max 2 pages)Highlight your legal experience, particularly in public interest law and digital rights advocacy.Motivational Letter (max 2 pages)Explain your interest in digital rights, your current work relevant to digital rights advocacy, and how this training will enhance your impact. Be sure to describe the specific digital rights challenges in your country context and how your proposed follow-up strategic actions after the training will address these local issues.Relevant Case Studies or Advocacy InitiativesShare any case studies or digital rights advocacy efforts you have contributed to, demonstrating your practical engagement with the field.Selection and NotificationApplications will be evaluated by a joint selection committee. Successful candidates will be notifiedby Tuesday August 5th, 2025.ContactFor queries, contact:Mr. Gabriel AcayeProgramme Officer – Membership & Capacity BuildingEast Africa Law SocietyP.O. Box 6240, Arusha, TanzaniaEmail:[email protected]|[email protected]Apply Now for the EALS Training for Public Interest Lawyers on Digital Rights in Sub Saharan AfricaFor More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the East Africa Law Society (EALS) Training for Public Interest Lawyers on Digital Rights
meta_title: Formation Droit Digital en Afrique Sub-Saharienne (Nairobi)
meta_description: Formation entièrement financée sur les droits numériques pour avocats engagés en Afrique subsaharienne. Candidatures jusqu'au 28 juillet 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: L'East Africa Law Society (EALS), en partenariat avec l'International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL), propose une formation entièrement financée sur les droits numériques pour les avocats engagés dans la défense des droits humains et des libertés numériques en Afrique subsaharienne.  Ce programme intensif se tiendra à Nairobi, au Kenya.

details.heading: Objectifs
details.text: Améliorer les compétences pratiques des avocats, favoriser la collaboration régionale et relever les défis juridiques émergents dans le domaine numérique.  La formation comprend un programme juridique contextualisé, des sessions dirigées par des experts, des ateliers pratiques et des possibilités de réseautage.

details.heading: Programme
details.text: La formation se déroulera du 21 au 22 août 2025 à Nairobi, au Kenya.  Elle couvrira des modules adaptés aux réalités nationales et régionales, des sessions avec des experts reconnus et des ateliers pratiques.  Les participants obtiendront 2 points de développement professionnel continu (CPD).

details.heading: Critères d'éligibilité
details.text: Les avocats engagés dans des litiges sur les droits humains, le plaidoyer pour les droits numériques ou la défense de l'espace civique sont invités à postuler.  Les candidatures des avocats travaillant dans des contextes de répression numérique accrue sont particulièrement encouragées.

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de candidature est le 28 juillet 2025 à 16h00, heure d'Afrique de l'Est.  Toutes les dépenses (voyage, hébergement, repas et matériel) seront prises en charge.  Les traductions en français et en anglais seront fournies.  Postulez via le formulaire en ligne.

main_image_alt: Image promotionnelle de la formation sur les droits numériques de l'EALS
organizer_logo_alt: Logo de l'East Africa Law Society (EALS)

title: UNESCO Open learning and mentorship program 2025 for African women in quantum science
subtitle: Un programme d'apprentissage ouvert et un programme de mentorat sélectif pour les étudiantes africaines en thèse de doctorat en sciences, technologies, ingénierie et mathématiques (STEM).
description: L'UNESCO lance un cours en ligne gratuit sur l'informatique quantique, accompagné d'un programme de mentorat pour 50 doctorantes africaines en STEM.  Les candidatures sont ouvertes jusqu'au 31 août 2025.
content: 283Application Deadline: 31 August 2025Applications are now open for the2025 UNESCO Open learning and mentorship program. Quantum science and technologies are rapidly shaping the future of science, security, economy and society. Yet women, especially those from the Global South, remain underrepresented in this critical field.To address this gap, UNESCO, in collaboration with leading quantum educators, is launching an open-access introductory course on quantum computing, paired with a selective training and mentorship programme for women PhD students in Africa.Participants will explore the fundamentals of quantum computing through a structured online course based on the open-source textbookLearn Quantum Computation using Qiskit. While the course is freely accessible to all learners, a dedicated mentorship opportunity will be offered to up to50 selected female PhD studentsin STEM fields from across Africa, with personalized support from international experts.Training and mentorshipIn addition to the open course, UNESCO is offering a dedicated mentorship and live training track for up to 50 outstanding female PhD students in STEM from across Africa.Eligibility:Female PhD students from Africa in STEM fieldsMust be familiar with linear algebraSelection:Based on CV and motivation letterUp to 50 participants will be selectedTimeline:Call opens: 31 July 2025Deadline to apply: 31 August 2025Participants announced: Mid-September 2025Live training begins: Late September 2025For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the UNESCO Open learning and mentorship program
meta_title: Programme UNESCO 2025 : Bourses Quantum pour femmes africaines
meta_description: Programme UNESCO de mentorat et d'apprentissage en informatique quantique pour 50 doctorantes africaines en STEM. Candidature jusqu'au 31 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: L'UNESCO, en collaboration avec des experts en éducation quantique, lance un programme d'apprentissage ouvert et un programme de mentorat pour les femmes africaines en doctorat dans le domaine des STEM, afin de combler le manque de représentation des femmes dans le domaine de l'informatique quantique.

details.heading: Programme d'apprentissage ouvert
details.text: Un cours en ligne gratuit sur l'informatique quantique, basé sur le livre Learn Quantum Computation using Qiskit, est accessible à tous.  Un programme de mentorat dédié est proposé à 50 doctorantes africaines sélectionnées.

details.heading: Programme de mentorat
details.text: Jusqu'à 50 doctorantes exceptionnelles en STEM d'Afrique bénéficieront d'un mentorat personnalisé et d'une formation en direct avec des experts internationaux. La sélection se base sur un CV et une lettre de motivation.

details.heading: Éligibilité et calendrier
details.text: Les candidates doivent être des doctorantes africaines en STEM, familiarisées avec l'algèbre linéaire.  Les candidatures sont ouvertes jusqu'au 31 août 2025, les résultats seront annoncés à la mi-septembre, et la formation débutera fin septembre 2025.

draft_summary.closing: Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulter le site web officiel du programme.  Date limite de candidature : 31 août 2025.

main_image_alt: Image promotionnelle du programme UNESCO Open learning and mentorship program 2025
organizer_logo_alt: Logo de l'UNESCO

title: Samsung EEIP Enterprise Development Program 2025 for black owned South African SMEs.
subtitle: Le programme Samsung EEIP 2025 soutient les entreprises sud-africaines noires dans les secteurs des TIC et de la réparation d'électronique.
description: Ce programme vise à soutenir les petites entreprises à fort potentiel, appartenant à des Noirs ou à des femmes noires, dans le secteur des TIC en Afrique du Sud.  Les candidats doivent répondre à des critères spécifiques de propriété, de chiffre d'affaires et d'expérience.
content: 3.1KApplication Deadline: unspecifiedApplications are now open for the2025 Samsung EEIP Enterprise Development Program.Samsung, in collaboration with the Department of Trade, Industry and Competition (“Dtic”), hereby invites black owned South African businesses. Join the programme of bringing positive change to the nation if you are an entrepreneur with experience in the business of:Information and Communication Technology (ICT)Service Centre repairs for mobile devices and consumer electronics; as well asto submit an application to participate in Samsung’s Enterprise Development (ED) Program under the Equity Equivalent Investment Program. The objective is to target black owned and black women owned high potential small enterprises in the ICT industryRequirementsYou have to be a South African Citizen and Company, registered in SA by laws of the country;Your business needs to be at least 51% black owned, operating for a minimum of one (1) year;Your turnover has to be less than R50 (fifty) million per annum;Your business has to be classified as an Exempted Micro Enterprise (“EME”) or Qualifying Small Enterprise (“QSE”), as defined in the Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment Act 53 of 2003 (as amended from-time-to-time);Proven track-record of operating in the Consumer Electronic Repair or ICT industries;You need to have the relevant certification and expertise for your business; andYou need to have good communication skills, business acumen, interpersonal skills and entrepreneurial capabilities.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the Samsung EEIP Enterprise Development Program
meta_title: Programme Samsung EEIP 2025 pour PME sud-africaines noires
meta_description: Samsung & Dtic lancent un programme de développement pour les entreprises sud-africaines noires possédant une expérience en TIC ou en réparation d'électronique.

draft_summary.introduction: Samsung, en partenariat avec le ministère sud-africain du Commerce, de l'Industrie et de la Concurrence (Dtic), lance son programme de développement d'entreprise EEIP 2025.  Ce programme cible les entreprises sud-africaines noires possédant une expérience dans les technologies de l'information et de la communication (TIC) ou la réparation d'appareils électroniques.

details.heading: Critères d'éligibilité
details.text: Pour être éligible, votre entreprise doit être sud-africaine, détenue à au moins 51% par des Noirs, opérationnelle depuis au moins un an, avoir un chiffre d'affaires inférieur à 50 millions de Rands par an, être classée comme EME ou QSE, et posséder une expertise prouvée dans les domaines ciblés.

details.heading: Compétences requises
details.text: Les candidats doivent démontrer de solides compétences en communication, en gestion d'entreprise, en relations interpersonnelles et en entrepreneuriat. Des certifications pertinentes sont également nécessaires.

draft_summary.closing: Pour plus d'informations et pour soumettre votre candidature, veuillez consulter la page web officielle du programme Samsung EEIP Enterprise Development Program. La date limite de candidature n'est pas spécifiée.

main_image_alt: Logo du programme Samsung EEIP Enterprise Development Program 2025
organizer_logo_alt: Logo de Samsung

title: The Global Center on Adaptation (GCA) My Adaptation Solution Video Competition 2025
subtitle: Présentez votre solution d'adaptation climatique innovante et gagnez !
description: Le Global Center on Adaptation (GCA) organise un concours vidéo pour les jeunes de 18 à 35 ans.  Soumettez une vidéo d'une minute présentant votre solution pour lutter contre le changement climatique.  Les gagnants seront sélectionnés par vote public.
content: 3.3KApplication Deadline:August 9th, 2025Applications are now open for the2025 GCA “My Adaptation Solution Video Competition”.The Youth Climate Adaptation Action Day, organized by the Global Center on Adaptation (GCA) on the 12th of October, is the largest-running annual youth adaptation event taking place in over 100 countries around the world.This competition spotlights solutions that break the heat cycle, safeguard water resources, and buffer communities against both drought and deluge. Your idea could reshape how we live, farm, and build in an increasingly hot world.RequirementsAre you between 18-35 years old and leading the fight against climate change?Have you developed an innovative and creative adaptation solution?Selection CriteriaWinners will be selected through public voting via an online form. Results will be announced in early September.Submission RequirementsThe thermometer is climbing, and so must our creativity. Share your heat-beating, NDC-aligned adaptation solution—submit your one-minute video today and help cool, protect, and sustain our planet’s future!The theme of video entries is: The heat is on — youth powering adaptation solutions through Nature-based Solutions, Water, Education & Advocacy, and Climate-Resilient Agriculture.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the GCA My Adaptation Solution Video Competition 2025
meta_title: Concours vidéo GCA 2025: Solutions d'adaptation climatique
meta_description: Participez au concours vidéo GCA 2025 et présentez votre solution d'adaptation climatique innovante. Date limite: 9 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: Le Global Center on Adaptation (GCA) lance son concours vidéo "My Adaptation Solution" 2025,  mettant en lumière des solutions innovantes pour lutter contre les effets du changement climatique.  Ouvert aux jeunes de 18 à 35 ans, ce concours récompense les initiatives axées sur les solutions fondées sur la nature, la gestion de l'eau, l'éducation, le plaidoyer et l'agriculture résiliente au climat.

details.heading: Critères de sélection
details.text: Les gagnants seront choisis par vote public en ligne. Les résultats seront annoncés début septembre 2025.

details.heading: Exigences de soumission
details.text: Soumettez une vidéo d'une minute présentant votre solution d'adaptation climatique. Le thème est : "La chaleur est là – les jeunes mettent en œuvre des solutions d'adaptation grâce aux solutions fondées sur la nature, à l'eau, à l'éducation et au plaidoyer, et à l'agriculture résiliente au climat."

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de soumission est le 9 août 2025. Pour plus d'informations, visitez le site Web officiel du concours.

main_image_alt: Image promotionnelle du concours vidéo GCA 2025
organizer_logo_alt: Logo du Global Center on Adaptation (GCA)

title: African Union CIEFFA Online Capacity Building Training 2025 for emerging leaders.
subtitle: Développez vos compétences en matière d'égalité des genres, de compétences numériques, d'entrepreneuriat et de littératie financière.
description: L'Union africaine CIEFFA et ImpactHER proposent une formation en ligne gratuite axée sur le développement des compétences et l'accès aux STEM pour les femmes et les hommes d'Afrique.  La formation commence en septembre 2025.
content: 11.9KApplication Deadline: August 16, 2025Applications are now open for the2025 African Union CIEFFA Online Capacity Building Training.The African Union CIEFFA and ImpactHER are co-hosting the public phase of the Online Capacity Building Training starting from September 2025 under the theme “#AfricaEducatesHer – Digital Skills for All: Bridging the Gender Gap in STEAM, Financial Literacy, and Entrepreneurship”. The training is targeted at women and men from 55 African Union Member States and the Diaspora who are interested in developing their skills and knowledge in Gender equality in and through Education, STEAM, digital literacy, financial literacy and entrepreneurship, as well as women teachers who want to enhance their capacity to teach digital literacy and STEAM subjects.The African Union CIEFFA and ImpactHER have come together to organize an online capacity building training on skills’ development and access to STEAM through gender responsive-education upscaling. This training seeks to address the challenges facing young women and men in Africa, particularly in the areas of STEAM, digital literacy, financial literacy and entrepreneurship. It also seeks to enhance the capacity of women teachers to teach digital literacy and STEAM subjects effectively.Eligibility CriteriaBe an African woman or man ;Be able to demonstrate the motivation to learn about: digital skills, entrepreneurial skills and financial literacy.Be able to demonstrate leadership abilities, aspirations and a commitment to the promotion of girls and women’s education;Have access to good internet connection and a device (laptop, computer, smartphone or tablet).Have a clear understanding of one of the training’s languages; English, French or Portuguese;Hold an African citizenship residing on the continent or anywhere in the world.P.S. Please note that the participants will be divided into batches. Each batch will be run for a period of 1 month starting from September 2025.BenefitsGain knowledge in Gender equality in and through Education, Digital Skills, Entrepreneurial Skills and Financial Literacy.Get a Certificate in each program: Digital Skills, Entrepreneurial Skills and Financial Literacy (participants need to attend at least 80% of the training courses per program to be eligible for certificates).Be part of African Union CIEFFA network and ImpactHER network.Increase  chances to be invited for fully-funded in-person activities by the African Union CIEFFA.Access to other fully-funded online training sponsored by ImpactHERFor More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the African Union CIEFFA Online Capacity Building Training
meta_title: Formation en ligne de l'UA CIEFFA 2025
meta_description: Formation en ligne gratuite sur les compétences numériques, l'entrepreneuriat et la finance pour les femmes et les hommes d'Afrique. Date limite : 16 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: L'Union africaine CIEFFA et ImpactHER organisent une formation en ligne gratuite sur le développement des compétences et l'accès aux STEM, axée sur l'égalité des genres.  Ouverte aux femmes et aux hommes des 55 États membres de l'Union africaine et de la diaspora, cette formation vise à combler le fossé numérique et à promouvoir l'entrepreneuriat.

details.heading: Objectifs de la formation
details.text: Développer des compétences en égalité des genres, en STEM, en littératie numérique, financière et entrepreneuriale. Améliorer les capacités des enseignantes à enseigner la littératie numérique et les matières STEM.

details.heading: Critères d'éligibilité
details.text: Être une femme ou un homme africain, motivé à apprendre les compétences numériques, entrepreneuriales et financières, posséder de bonnes compétences de leadership, avoir accès à une connexion internet et un appareil, comprendre l'anglais, le français ou le portugais, détenir une citoyenneté africaine.

details.heading: Avantages
details.text: Acquérir des connaissances dans divers domaines, obtenir un certificat (80% de présence requise), faire partie des réseaux de l'UA CIEFFA et d'ImpactHER, avoir des chances d'être invité à des activités en présentiel financées, accès à d'autres formations en ligne financées par ImpactHER.

draft_summary.closing: La formation se déroulera en plusieurs sessions d'un mois à partir de septembre 2025.  Date limite de candidature : 16 août 2025.  Pour plus d'informations, visitez le site web officiel.

main_image_alt: Image promotionnelle de la formation en ligne de l'UA CIEFFA 2025
organizer_logo_alt: Logo de l'Union africaine CIEFFA

title: AERC-World Bank Visiting Scholars Programme 2026 for African Researchers.
subtitle: Le programme de chercheurs visiteurs offre aux chercheurs de l'AERC la possibilité de travailler à la Banque mondiale sur des recherches liées au développement économique en Afrique.
description: Sélectionnés parmi les membres du réseau AERC, les chercheurs sélectionnés passeront 4 à 6 mois à la Banque mondiale, collaborant avec ses chercheurs et contribuant à ses travaux de recherche.
content: 2.3KApplication Deadline:September 1, 2025Applications are now open for the2026 AERC-World Bank Visiting Scholars Programme.The visiting scholars program provides an opportunity for AERC researchers to visit the World Bank for four-six months, with a total of three researchers visiting every year. Visiting scholars will be selected from among AERC network members based on set guidelines including the World Bank’s policies and procedures.AERC invites its network researchers and faculty to submit an expression of interest to participate in the AERC-World Bank visiting scholars program. The fellowship programme will enable participants to spend time at the World Bank, work on their own research relevant to economic development in Africa, and to work with the World Bank’s researchers to develop, especially those in the Africa Region.Visiting ScholarsThe visiting scholars will be expected to be part of the Office of the Chief Economist for Africa Region (AFRCE) team; attend AFRCE-led activities; benefit from capacity-building efforts being organized by AFRCE, including collaboration with scholars and peers doing analytical work on World Bank Regional Flagship Studies; interact with the World Bank’s researchers; fully utilize the World Bank’s resources to: (i) revise their draft paper and submit it to the World Bank Working Paper Series and a ranking Journal; (ii) present at least one seminar on their own research while in the program; (iii) contribute meaningfully to the World Bank’s Africa Region ongoing research and analytical work; (iv) develop a repository of research interests; and (v) comply with all other terms and conditions included in their terms of reference and applicable consultancy contract.Eligibility Criteria:Must be an AERC researcher, including researchers from the AERC collaborative PhD programme CPP);Must have an active AERC research project at least at interim/post field stage or final research paper stage; andThe research project must be pertinent to the research agenda of the World Bank Africa Region, and imperatives for sustained African development.Application Process:The expression of interest by applicants should include:A two-page statement of interest.A draft paper on a subject pertinent to the research agenda of the Africa region of the World Bank   and imperatives facing African development.If you teach a relevant course, the curriculum/course materials that you would like to improve while visiting the World Bank; andCopy of your updated curriculum vitae.Application packages must be emailed to the AERC Research Department ([email protected]).Up to 3 awardswill be announced in 2025/2026 cohort.Please submit your expression of interest on or before the (September 1, 2025).Late applications will not be considered.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the AERC-World Bank Visiting Scholars Programme
meta_title: Programme de chercheurs visiteurs AERC-Banque mondiale 2026
meta_description: Opportunité pour les chercheurs africains de visiter la Banque mondiale (4-6 mois). Candidatures ouvertes jusqu'au 1er septembre 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: Le Programme de chercheurs visiteurs AERC-Banque mondiale 2026 offre une opportunité unique aux chercheurs africains de l'AERC (African Economic Research Consortium) de passer 4 à 6 mois à la Banque mondiale.  Ce programme vise à soutenir la recherche sur le développement économique en Afrique et à favoriser la collaboration entre chercheurs.

details.heading: Admissibilité
details.text: Être chercheur AERC (y compris le programme de doctorat collaboratif CPP); avoir un projet de recherche AERC actif au moins au stade intermédiaire/post-terrain ou au stade de l'article final; le projet de recherche doit être pertinent pour le programme de recherche de la région Afrique de la Banque mondiale et les impératifs d'un développement africain durable.

details.heading: Processus de candidature
details.text: Les candidats doivent soumettre une déclaration d'intérêt (2 pages), un projet d'article, un programme/supports de cours (si applicable) et un CV mis à jour.  Les candidatures doivent être envoyées à l'adresse email de l'AERC Research Department.

details.heading: Activités des chercheurs visiteurs
details.text: Les chercheurs participeront à l'équipe du Bureau de l'économiste en chef pour la région Afrique (AFRCE), assisteront aux activités menées par l'AFRCE, bénéficieront des efforts de renforcement des capacités, interagiront avec les chercheurs de la Banque mondiale, réviseront leur article pour la série de documents de travail de la Banque mondiale et un journal classé, présenteront un séminaire et contribueront aux travaux de recherche de la Banque mondiale.

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de candidature est le 1er septembre 2025.  Seules trois bourses seront attribuées. Pour plus d'informations, veuillez visiter la page web officielle du programme.

title: The Global Development Challenge (GDC) 2025 Global Voices Essay Challenge for students worldwide.
subtitle: Le Global Development Challenge (GDC) 2025 invite les étudiants à explorer la transformation numérique inclusive dans les pays à faible et moyen revenu (PRFM).
description: Ce concours d'essai récompense les réflexions originales sur les opportunités et les défis de la transformation numérique dans les PRFM. Les gagnants seront invités à la conférence GDC 2025 à Clermont-Ferrand.
content: 2.5KApplication Deadline: July 15, 2025Applications are now open for the2025 Global Development Challenge (GDC) Global Voices Essay Challenge.  The GDC 2025 Global Voices Essay Challenge invites students to respond to the question:“What does inclusive digital transformation mean for sustainable development in Low- and middle-income countries (LMICs)?”Participants are encouraged to reflect on how digital transformation is reshaping societies and economies in LMICs, and to explore both its opportunities and its challenges, such as digital inequality, algorithmic bias, youth activism, and governance gaps.Essays should express original viewpoints, drawing from personal observation, local examples, or emerging trends, and propose clear ideas or recommendations to make digital transformation more inclusive and impactful for sustainable development.CATEGORIESThe challenge is open to students across three academic levels:Undergraduate Students:Essays may include personal perspectives, observations, and early reflections on digital transformation and its social impact.Master’s Students:Essays should present policy ideas, critical reflections, or grounded arguments on digital equity, governance, or innovation.PhD Students:Essays may include deeper, specialised insights based on academic or professional exposure, while maintaining an accessible and opinion-driven tone.ELIGIBILITY CRITERIAThe challenge is open to students  who meet one of the following criteriaAre currently enrolled at an academic institution in a low- and middle-income country (LMIC);Have graduated from an academic institution in an LMIC within the last six months;Are currently based in Clermont-Ferrand, France, regardless of nationalityPRIZESWinners will be invited to attend GDC 2025 in Clermont-Ferrand, France, where they will:Participate in a communications workshop hosted by theGlobalDev Blog.Be featured in a special publication on digital transformation featuring selected winning essays.Publish their work and be promoted through GDN’s digital platforms and partner channels.Receive an official Certificate of Achievement from GDN.Selected winners may also be offered opportunities for continued engagement, including the chance to participate in special GDN activities, such as workshops, editorial collaborations, or a potential panel discussion.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the Global Development Challenge (GDC) Global Voices Essay Challenge
meta_title: Concours d'essai GDC 2025 : Transformation numérique inclusive
meta_description: Participez au concours d'essai GDC 2025 et partagez votre vision de la transformation numérique inclusive pour un développement durable dans les pays à revenu faible et intermédiaire.

draft_summary.introduction: Le Global Development Challenge (GDC) 2025 lance un concours d'essai sur la transformation numérique inclusive pour un développement durable dans les pays à faible et moyen revenu (PRFM).  Les étudiants sont invités à soumettre leurs réflexions originales sur ce sujet crucial.

details.heading: Thème
details.text: "Que signifie la transformation numérique inclusive pour le développement durable dans les pays à faible et moyen revenu (PRFM) ?"

details.heading: Éligibilité
details.text: Ouvert aux étudiants actuellement inscrits ou récemment diplômés d'une institution académique d'un PRFM, ou basés à Clermont-Ferrand.

details.heading: Prix
details.text: Les gagnants seront invités à la conférence GDC 2025 à Clermont-Ferrand, participeront à un atelier de communication, verront leur essai publié et recevront un certificat.

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de soumission est le 15 juillet 2025.  Pour plus d'informations, consultez le site web officiel du Global Development Challenge.

main_image_alt: Image du logo du Global Development Challenge (GDC)

title: Islamic Development Bank (ISDB) Internship 2025/2026 for young Nigerians.

title: Journalists for Human Rights (JHR) Journalists for SRHR Masterclass 2025
subtitle: Une bourse de journalisme de six mois axée sur des reportages percutants, éthiques et axés sur les solutions concernant les droits en matière de santé sexuelle et reproductive.
description: Journalistes pour les droits de l'homme (JHR) invite les journalistes, rédacteurs, producteurs et réseaux médiatiques d'Afrique de l'Est et australe à postuler pour cette bourse.  Le programme comprend des webinaires, une formation intensive et une subvention pour la production d'articles.
content: 991Application Deadline:July 31, 2025.Applications are now open for the2025Journalists for Human Rights (JHR)Journalists for SRHR Masterclass 2025. Journalists for Human Rights (JHR) invites journalists, editors, producers, media networks, and Guilds from the East and Southern Africa regions to apply for the Journalists for SRHR Masterclass, a dynamic six-month journalism fellowship focused on impactful, ethical, and solutions-oriented reporting on sexual and reproductive health rights.The Journalists for SRHR Masterclassis an initiative by the World Health Organization, in collaboration with UNAIDS, UNFPA, and UNICEF, as part of the2gether 4 SRHR Programme, a joint regional effort implemented by the four agencies in partnership with the Regional SRHR Team of Sweden. This joint programme leverages the comparative strengths and technical expertise of the participating UN agencies to deliver as one. It aims to improve sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) for all people in Eastern and Southern Africa through a regional approach grounded in applied learning at the country level.The journalism fellowship will offer a series of webinars that provide comprehensive training to enhance journalists’ understanding of and reporting on issues related to sexual and reproductive health. The training will pay special attention to the relevant context and nuances specific to the East and Southern Africa regions.The fellowship will run for six months, during which journalists will undergo intensive training to gain practical experience in reporting on various SRHR issues. This hands-on experience aims to elevate critical sexual and reproductive health topics across the continent and foster transformative discussions on these rights. Those who successfully complete the program will qualify for a story production grant and mentorship.Ultimately, the fellowship seeks to influence policy changes that prioritize sexual and reproductive health rights in East and Southern Africa.Eligibility CriteriaYou must;Be a practising and accredited journalist in their country of jurisdiction;Demonstrate prior knowledge, experience and interest in covering SRHR-related topics;Be affiliated with a credible media outlet that may be required to support the fellows’ work;Show proof of confirmation from a media outlet to publish (applicable to freelance journalists);Reside and report in East and Southern African countries;Must be available to participate in the masterclass sessions fully;Have at least three years of experience in journalism;Be proficient in either English, French or Portuguese;JHR encourage female journalists and key populations to apply.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the Journalists for Human Rights (JHR) Journalists for SRHR Masterclass
meta_title: Bourse Journalisme SRHR 2025 - JHR
meta_description: Bourse de 6 mois pour journalistes d'Afrique de l'Est et australe pour un reportage sur les droits en matière de santé sexuelle et reproductive. Candidature jusqu'au 31 juillet 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: Le programme Journalists for SRHR Masterclass 2025 offre une bourse de journalisme de six mois aux journalistes, rédacteurs, producteurs et réseaux médiatiques d'Afrique de l'Est et australe.  Ce programme vise à améliorer les reportages sur les droits en matière de santé sexuelle et reproductive (SRHR).

details.heading: Formation
details.text: La bourse comprend une série de webinaires et une formation intensive axés sur les contextes et les nuances spécifiques à l'Afrique de l'Est et australe.  Une attention particulière sera portée à la production d'articles percutants, éthiques et axés sur les solutions.

details.heading: Admissibilité
details.text: Les candidats doivent être des journalistes expérimentés et accrédités, démontrer une connaissance des sujets liés aux SRHR, être affiliés à un média crédible et résider dans les pays d'Afrique de l'Est et australe.  Une expérience d'au moins trois ans est requise, et la maîtrise de l'anglais, du français ou du portugais est nécessaire.

details.heading: Avantages
details.text: Les boursiers recevront une formation intensive, une expérience pratique, une subvention pour la production d'articles et un mentorat.  Le programme vise à influencer les politiques et à promouvoir les droits en matière de santé sexuelle et reproductive.

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de candidature est le 31 juillet 2025. Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulter le site Web officiel des Journalistes pour les droits de l'homme (JHR).

title: South African National Parks (SANParks) External Bursary Programme 2026 for young South Africans.

description: Le programme de bourses externes de SANParks 2026 soutient les jeunes Sud-Africains résidant à proximité des parcs nationaux pour des études supérieures.  Les candidatures sont ouvertes jusqu'au 18 août 2025.
content: 481Application Deadline: 18 August 2025Applications are now open for the2026 South African National Parks (SANParks) External Bursary Programme.The South African National Parks (SANParks) is looking for aspiring youth entering their first year of undergraduate studies in the 2026 academic year to join our external bursary programme.This bursary scheme is intended to benefit   children residing in communities neighbouring or adjacent to of the National Parks and will be implemented by the SANParks.Bursary ApplicationThe Field of study applied for but not limited, include Degree & National Diploma in the field of:Environmental Sciences including Nature Conservation, Environmental management, Green Energy, Environmental Engineering, sustainable development and Game ranch managementTourism including Hospitality Management, Resort Management, Tour guide, Events and Conference Management.Social Sciences including Community Development, Economic Development, Socio-Economic Development and related Development studiesRequirementsRecipients of the SANParks bursary Scheme must be South African citizens.They must be learners from communities living adjacent to National Parks as defined in their management plans. Attach a link to find the Management plans on SANParks Website.Proof of application and admission to an accredited institution of Higher Education eligibility for funding.Must be entering post matric study in 2026.The bursary is open to students who are pursuing a qualification in a TVET college.Must be youth 18 – 35For students currently registered at Institution of Higher Education, they must have a 100% pass rate to be considered (passed all the courses for which you have registered for at the university for the study period already completed).How To ApplyInterested candidates who meet the above requirements should forward their applications accompanied by the required documentation listed below to the following:Documents RequiredMotivation letter indicating the reasons for the required bursary as well as the field of study you are applying for;A Comprehensive updated CV.A copy of your certified identity document;A copy of your certified latest academic record.Acceptance letter from the registered / accredited public institution of Higher Education (University, TVET, College, University of Technology) andProof of residential address.EMAIL US AT:[email protected]For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the South African National Parks (SANParks) External Bursary Programme
meta_title: Bourses SANParks 2026 pour jeunes Sud-Africains
meta_description: SANParks offre des bourses aux jeunes Sud-Africains résidant près des parcs nationaux pour des études supérieures en 2026. Date limite : 18 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: Le South African National Parks (SANParks) lance son programme de bourses externes 2026 pour les jeunes Sud-Africains.  Ce programme vise à soutenir les étudiants issus de communautés voisines des parcs nationaux.

details.heading: Critères d'éligibilité
details.text: Être citoyen sud-africain, résider près d'un parc national, être admis dans un établissement d'enseignement supérieur accrédité pour 2026 (université ou TVET), avoir entre 18 et 35 ans, et (pour les étudiants déjà inscrits) un taux de réussite de 100%.

details.heading: Domaines d'études
details.text: Sciences de l'environnement (conservation de la nature, gestion de l'environnement, énergies vertes…), tourisme (gestion hôtelière, gestion de station…), sciences sociales (développement communautaire, développement économique…).

details.text: Lettre de motivation, CV, copie certifiée de la pièce d'identité, relevé de notes, lettre d'admission de l'établissement d'enseignement supérieur, justificatif de domicile.

draft_summary.closing: Les candidatures doivent être envoyées par e-mail à [email protected] avant le 18 août 2025.  Pour plus d'informations, consultez le site web officiel de SANParks.

title: British Council’s Research Environments 2025/2026 collaboration grants
subtitle: Les subventions soutiennent le renforcement des capacités et les activités de collaboration pour développer les liens entre les environnements de recherche du Royaume-Uni et de quatre pays partenaires.

content: 2.6KApplication Deadline: 9 September, 2025 23.59 UK timeApplications are now open for the2025/2026 British Council’s Research Environments collaboration grants.The grants support capacity strengthening and collaboration activities that help develop research environment connections between the UK and Brazil, Morocco, Pakistan and Peru.Key detailsGrant amount:£25,000 to £40,000Project length:12 months, starting January 2026unding can be used to establish new research environment links, or significantly develop existing links, between research groups, departments or institutions, with the potential for longer-term sustainability.Each collaboration should support capacity strengthening in the partner institution, while stimulating longer-term interactions between the UK and the partner country.EligibilityThe call accepts joint proposals from one lead UK institution and one lead partner country institution. The application must be submitted by the lead UK institution.UK lead institutions must be one of the following:A higher education provider with degree awarding powersA not-for-profit research institution, establishment or organisation.Partner country institutions must be one of the following:A higher education provider, as locally definedA not-for-profit research institutions, establishments and organisations, as locally defined.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the British Council’s Research Environments collaboration grants.

title: UNHCR Refugee-led Innovation Fund 2025 for refugee-led organizations
subtitle: Le Fonds d'innovation dirigé par des réfugiés soutient les initiatives innovantes conçues et mises en œuvre par des organisations dirigées par des personnes déplacées de force.
description: Ce fonds offre un soutien financier, un mentorat et une expertise aux organisations dirigées par des réfugiés, demandeurs d'asile, personnes déplacées, rapatriés et apatrides.  Les candidatures sont ouvertes jusqu'au 22 août 2025.
content: 3.5KApplication Deadline:22 August 2025 at 23:59 Panama time.Applications are now open for the2025 UNHCR Refugee-led Innovation Fund.The Refugee-led Innovation Fund champions the creativity of all displaced and stateless people. It aims to reshape their participation in the delivery of humanitarian work by ensuring they take centre stage in the decisions affecting their lives, leading the identification of needs and the design of innovative solutions.The Fund provides holistic support – combining financial resources, mentoring, and other expertise – directly to organizations led by forcibly displaced and stateless people, to enable them to design and deliver new interventions that have a lasting positive impact on their communities.RequirementsThe Fund supports innovation by all organizations led by people with lived experience of forced displacement or statelessness – including refugees, asylum-seekers, the internally displaced, returnees, and stateless people – that are recognized within their communities due to their past significant contributions.Applicants are required to apply as a team, representing an existing organization made up of multiple community members. Organizations must demonstrate a collective structure to qualify. Individual applicants are not eligible.The Fund accepts applications fromboth registered and unregistered organizationsthat are well known in their communities due to their past significant contributions and initiatives.Additional attention will be given to ensuring organizations led by LGBTIQ+ persons, women, people with disabilities, internally displaced and stateless individuals, Indigenous populations, and other underrepresented groups receive support and encouragement to apply to the Fund.BenefitsSelected organizations can expect the following:Financial support:Organizations can apply for up to 45,000 USD (equivalent in local currency) in funding to test and implement ideas with strong community-based approaches that generate value for community members, not specifically linked to any thematic area or technology.Programme and project management support:Supported organizations will receive assistance from UNHCR and experts to help build their capacity to design and implement programmes effectively.Technical support and expertise:Needs-based specialist advice will be offered, on topics ranging from technology to legal support and innovation methodologies.Peer-to-peer networking:Supported organizations will be encouraged to engage with each other, share experiences, learn from each other, and explore partnerships.An emphasis on learning:Support will be provided to enable supported organizations to measure outcomes, assess their progress, and gather information to support growth. They will be encouraged to document, share, and make use of relevant learnings. Discussion and reflection with their communities will enable them to incorporate and respond to feedback.Other support, based on project needs, could include organizational support, help with project sustainability and scale, training on specific topics, business model advice, and media and communications support.How to applyEach year, we launch a new call for applications inviting organizations to submit a proposal throughthis online platform. In their proposal, organizations should outline the challenge they aim to address, their proposed solution, a budget, and the changes they expect to see in their communities as a result of their project.In 2025, applications are open until August 22.These proposals go through a four-phase selection process:1) Proposal longlisting:The Innovation Service reviews all submissions and identifies a longlist of promising applications.2) Vetting and due diligence:Longlisted organizations undergo a thorough vetting and due diligence process to confirm their eligibility. Part of this process involves verifying that each organization’s leadership comprises at least 50% individuals with lived experience of forced displacement or statelessness. Supporting documentation must be provided to verify this. Failure to meet this requirement or to provide the necessary documentation will result in disqualification from the application process.3) Pitch your idea:Organizations that pass the vetting and due diligence process will be invited to pitch their ideas to a selection committee composed of members of the UNHCR Innovation Service, as well as representatives from the relevant UNHCR Country Operations and Regional Bureaus. This is an opportunity for organizations to expand on their submitted proposal and engage in a conversation about their idea. Organizations that successfully defend their idea will be shortlisted and move to the final phase of the selection process.4) Final selection:Shortlisted proposals are reviewed by the Fund’s Steering Committee, which is composed of forcibly displaced and stateless individuals, representatives of relevant UNHCR units at the global level, and, where feasible, donor representatives. The Steering Committee will select the most promising ideas to be endorsed by the Fund.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the UNHCR Refugee-led Innovation Fund
meta_title: Fonds d'innovation dirigé par des réfugiés UNHCR 2025
meta_description: Financement jusqu'à 45 000 USD pour les organisations dirigées par des réfugiés. Date limite : 22 août 2025. Soumettez votre candidature dès aujourd'hui !

title: UNIDIR Outer Space Security Conference 2025 Youth Video Competition (Fully Funded trip to Geneva, Switzerland)
subtitle: Concours vidéo pour les jeunes sur la sécurité spatiale en 2050.  Voyage tout frais payé à Genève offert aux gagnants.
description: L'UNIDIR organise un concours vidéo pour les jeunes de 18 à 25 ans.  Le thème est la sécurité spatiale en 2050. Les gagnants remportent un voyage à Genève pour la conférence OS25.
content: 3.2KApplication Deadline: July 18, 2025Applications are now open for the2025 UNIDIR Outer Space Security Conference Youth Video Competition. On 9-10 September, UNIDIR will host its annualOuter Space Security Conference(#OS25) in Geneva, Switzerland, and online. This flagship event brings together diplomats, technical experts, military officials, private sector leaders, and academics to explore the evolving landscape of space security and shape international responses to its challenges.The OS25 competition aims to:Encourage the next generationto shape inclusive space governance.Promote meaningful youth engagementin global space security discussions.Showcase creative and diverse perspectiveson the future of space security.ThemeUNIDIR invites individuals aged 18–25 from around the world to submit a 1–3-minute original video on the following theme:It’s the year 2050. You work on outer space security, shaping space governance as a treaty negotiator, orbital traffic controller, policy advisor, infrastructure inspector – or something else entirely. What challenge do you face and how are you responding?Individualsaged 18–25from any country.How to participate?Video:Create a 1-3-minute video based on this year’s theme.Submission and deadline:Completethis submission formbyFriday, 18 July 2025.Contact:For questions or technical issues, please email[email protected].Submission guidelinesOnlyone submission per personis allowed.Submissions must beoriginal contentcreated by the entrant.AI-generated images or videos are strictly prohibitedand will result in disqualification.Entries mustcomply with applicable lawsand be free of copyrighted material not owned by the creator.Technical requirementsVideos must be submitted in.mp4 format, with audio, visuals, and subtitles in one file.Any languagemay be used, but videos not in English must include English closed captions.If possible, videos should be produced inlandscape (horizontal) mode, rather than portrait (vertical) mode. Portrait videos, however, will not be disqualified.BenefitsA fully funded trip to Geneva, Switzerland, toattend the OS25– including round-trip economy airfare, accommodation for the duration of the conference, and per diems to cover some meals during those dates.Lightning talk premiere of the winners’ videos during the conference with the opportunity topresent the videos to a global audience.Selected videos willbe featured on the UNIDIR website.Selected winners will have an opportunity to transform their video and OS25 experience into abrief commentaryto be published on the UNIDIR website.Selection criteriaSubmissions will be evaluated based on:Originality and creativityRelevance to the themeClarity and technical qualityAwareness of space security issuesEngaging and thoughtful deliveryAll submissions will be reviewed according to the pre-established criteria by adiverse panel of judges drawn from across UNIDIR and CIGI. The judging process is designed to ensure fairness, balance and transparency, with attention to geographic, gender and disciplinary diversity.Entries that reflect youth, gender and regional diversity perspectives are highly encouraged.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the UNIDIR Outer Space Security Conference Youth Video Competition.

details.text: Imaginez-vous en 2050, travaillant dans le domaine de la sécurité spatiale. Quel défi rencontrez-vous et comment y répondez-vous ?

details.text: Originalité, pertinence au thème, clarté, qualité technique, connaissance des enjeux de la sécurité spatiale et présentation captivante.

content: 23.6KApplication Deadline:29 August 2025Applications are now open for the2026 CSIR-SASOL Foundation Bursary Programme. The CSIR, in collaboration with the Sasol Foundation, provides financial support to full-time, unemployed students seeking qualifications in areas that are deemed a priority by the CSIR.The bursary is open to academically qualifying young people and aims to attract and increase the participation of women, black individuals and people with disabilities in science, engineering and technology, specifically in the areas of study mentioned below:EligibilityAreas for an Undergraduate BursaryMechatronic EngineeringComputer EngineeringElectronic EngineeringComputer ScienceChemical EngineeringMaterial Flow AnalysisProcess Engineering/Life cycle assessmentInformation TechnologyData ScienceIndustrial EngineeringGenetics/Cell BiologySystem EngineeringRequirementsCurrent Grade 12 learners:South African citizen;Must intend to enrol full-time for the degree of choice at a South African public university;English (Level 5);Mathematics (Level 6); andPhysical Science (Level 6).Current university students:Must be a South African citizen;Planning to enrol full-time at a South African university for 2025; andMust have passed all registered courses for the completed study period at the university.BenefitsThis is a comprehensive bursary, and it covers all the costs associated with university studies, such as:For undergraduatesRegistration feesTuition feesBooksAccommodationLiving allowancesOnce-off laptop allowanceAcademic merit will be considered during the selection process, and it is imperative to increase the participation of women, black individuals and people with disabilities in science, engineering and technology.Application Procedure:The following documents must accompany your application:An updated CV;A copy of your certified identity document;A copy of your latest academic record; andA copy of the Grade 11 final year results (for current Grade 12 learners).Failure to attach these documents will result in your application being null and void.For More Information:Visit the Official Webpage of the CSIR-SASOL Foundation Bursary Programme
meta_title: Bourse CSIR-Sasol 2026: Études en STIM pour jeunes Sud-Africains
meta_description: Bourses CSIR-Sasol 2026 pour étudiants sud-africains en sciences, ingénierie et technologie. Candidatures ouvertes jusqu'au 29 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: Le programme de bourses CSIR-Sasol 2026 offre un financement complet aux étudiants sud-africains à temps plein poursuivant des études supérieures dans des domaines prioritaires des sciences, de l'ingénierie et de la technologie.  Ce programme vise à augmenter la participation des femmes, des personnes noires et des personnes handicapées.

details.heading: Domaines d'études éligibles
details.text: Ingénierie mécatronique, informatique, électronique; Science informatique, génie chimique; Analyse des flux de matériaux, génie des procédés/analyse du cycle de vie; Technologies de l'information, science des données, génie industriel; Génétique/biologie cellulaire, ingénierie des systèmes.

details.heading: Exigences
details.text: Pour les élèves de terminale : citoyenneté sud-africaine, inscription à temps plein dans une université publique sud-africaine, notes minimales en anglais, mathématiques et sciences physiques. Pour les étudiants universitaires : citoyenneté sud-africaine, inscription à temps plein pour 2025, réussite des cours inscrits.

details.heading: Avantages
details.text: Frais d'inscription, frais de scolarité, livres, logement, allocations de subsistance, allocation unique pour ordinateur portable.

details.heading: Documents requis
details.text: CV, copie de la carte d'identité certifiée conforme, relevé de notes, copie des résultats de l'année de terminale (pour les élèves de terminale).

draft_summary.closing: La date limite de candidature est le 29 août 2025. Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulter le site Web officiel du programme de bourses CSIR-Sasol.

title: Call For Applications: African Development Bank In-Country YouthADAPT Challenge 2025 For MSMEs and Innovators in Africa (Up to $30,000 Grant, Training and Mentorship)
subtitle: Subventions jusqu'à 30 000$, mentorat et opportunités de réseautage pour les jeunes entreprises axées sur le climat en Afrique.
description: Le programme In-Country YouthADAPT Challenge soutient les jeunes entrepreneurs africains développant des solutions innovantes pour l'adaptation au changement climatique dans les secteurs de l'agriculture et des infrastructures.  Les candidats doivent être âgés de 18 à 35 ans et avoir une entreprise légalement enregistrée.
content: ShareThe In-country YouthADAPT Challenge is calling on youth-led MSMEs and innovators to drive climate adaptation and resilience across Africa.Are you a young entrepreneur operating in any of the following 5 countries in Africa (Kenya, Tanzania, Rwanda, Ghana, Nigeria) seeking to raise funds for your climate impact business?Stand a chance to win a grant to grow your business, plus lots of other benefits.Africa is on the frontlines of climate change. From erratic weather disrupting agriculture to floods damaging critical infrastructure, the impacts are being felt across sectors—threatening livelihoods, mobility, and food security. We are calling on younth-led MSMEs to bring forward innovative, scalable, and locally relevant solutions that strengthen the country’s resilience to climate shocks. This Call for Solutions seeks bold ideas that address pressing adaptation needs in agriculture and infrastructure, in five countries with a focus on digital tools, green technologies, and community-driven models.This competition is part of the Africa Adaptation Acceleration Program (AAAP) developed and implemented by the African Development Bank(AfDB) and the Global Center on Adaptation(GCA).EligibilityWho Can Apply?We’re looking for innovative solutions that build resilience to climate change impacts. Here’s what you need to qualify, with priority given to entrepreneurs from our focus countries.Age RequirementEntrepreneurs must be between 18-35 years old at the time of application.Business RegistrationYour business must be legally registered to operate in an African country.Revenue GenerationBusiness must have generated revenues over a minimum two-year period.Business PlanMust have a SMART business plan for your climate adaptation solution.Impact FocusBusiness must demonstrate direct impact in food security or infrastructure.Eligible CountriesWhile applications are welcome from across Africa, preference will be given to entrepreneurs from these strategic countries driving climate innovation.GhanaKenyaNigeriaRwandaTanzaniaIf you meet these criteria and have a climate adaptation solution focused on food security or infrastructure, we’d love to hear from you.BenefitsThe In-Country YouthADAPT Challenge offers comprehensive support to transform your climate innovation from concept to market-ready solution with measurable impact.Innovation SupportUp to $30,000 in funding plus dedicated mentorship from industry experts to develop and scale your climate solution.Dragon’s Den Pitch EventExclusive platform to present your solution to investors, partners, and stakeholders in a high-visibility national event.Accelerated Growth12-month comprehensive program with workshops, technical assistance, and milestone-based support to fast-track your growth.Networking OpportunitiesAccess to exclusive investor networks, partnership opportunities, and connections with fellow climate entrepreneurs across Africa.Investment ConnectionsDirect access to our partner investor network and opportunities for follow-on funding to scale your impact.Scale-Up SupportComprehensive scaling assistance including strategic partnerships, market expansion guidance, and access to follow-on investment opportunities.Deadline: 4th August, 2025ClickHEREto ApplyPost Ce concours offre des subventions, du mentorat et des opportunités de réseautage aux jeunes entrepreneurs.

details.text: Les candidats doivent être âgés de 18 à 35 ans, avoir une entreprise légalement enregistrée, générer des revenus depuis au moins deux ans, posséder un business plan clair et démontrer un impact direct sur la sécurité alimentaire ou les infrastructures.

details.heading: Avantages
details.text: Les lauréats recevront jusqu'à 30 000$ de financement, un mentorat d'experts, la participation à un événement de pitch, un programme d'accélération de 12 mois et un accès à des réseaux d'investisseurs.

title: Call For Applications: NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative 2025 Phase 2 (Fully Funded Training, N30,000 monthly stipend, Certification, Starter Pack (Tools & Loan)
subtitle: L'Initiative d'Emploi Renouvelé de la Direction Nationale de l'Emploi (NDE) offre une formation technique, professionnelle et numérique entièrement financée, ainsi qu'une allocation mensuelle et un kit de démarrage.
description: Le programme NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative offre une formation gratuite, une allocation mensuelle de ₦30,000, un certificat et un kit de démarrage pour aider les Nigérians à trouver un emploi ou à démarrer une entreprise.  Les candidatures sont ouvertes jusqu'au 11 août 2025.
content: ShareThe NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative offers a fully funded technical, vocational, and digital training program, ₦30,000 monthly stipend, certificate of completion, and starter packs for selected applicants.The National Directorate of Employment (NDE) has kick-start a strategic Renewed Hope Employment Initiative to realign its operations with President Bola Ahmed Tinubu’s renewed hope agenda. This effort seeks to strengthen the agency’s role in combating poverty by providing sustainable employment opportunities for Nigerians.The National Directorate of Employment (NDE) is mandated to design and implement programmes to combat mass unemployment, articulate policies aimed at developing work programmes.The NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative (RHEI) Phase 2 is an initiative of the National Directorate of Employment (NDE) aimed at providing unemployed Nigerians with hands-on skills to enhance their employability and entrepreneurial capabilities.Eligibility Criteria:Be a NigerianBe between 18 and 45 yearBe ready to learn, work, or build a businessEligible Individuals include;Unemployed Youths & School LeaversGraduatesArtisans & Informal WorkersWomenPersons with Disabilities (PWDs)Farmers & Rural DwellersMiddle-Aged & RetireesInterns & ApprenticesSmall Business OwnersBenefitsThe benefits of the National Directorate of Employment NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative 2025 include;Fully funded Training: All training fees covered directly by NDE training fund.₦30,000 Monthly Stipend to help cover your learning expensesNDE Certificate of CompletionStarter packs upon training completion to begin your businessAccess to low-interest business loans to support your start-up expensesAvailable ProgramsVocational Skills Development (VSD)Small Scale Enterprises (SSE)Rural Employment Promotion (REP)Special Public Work (SPW)Deadline: August 11, 2025ClickHEREto ApplyPost Views:29,835ShareRelated Posts:Ultimate 2025 Guide to the Top Business Enabling…MSME Africa Unveils Top 50 Remarkable MSME Founders…15 Social Media Management Tools That Will Make Life…Call For Applications: Pulitzer ACE Micro Grants…How to Apply for Federal Ministry of Education…Nigerian Government Agencies that Support…Tags:000 monthly stipendCall for ApplicationsCertification)Fully Funded TrainingMSME AfricaN30NDE Renewed Hope Employment Initiative 2025 Phase 2OpportunitiesStarter PackTools
meta_title: NDE Renewed Hope Initiative: Bourse, Formation & Emploi au Nigeria
meta_description: Programme de formation technique et professionnelle entièrement financé au Nigeria. Bourse de ₦30,000, certificat et kit de démarrage inclus. Candidature jusqu'au 11 août 2025.

draft_summary.introduction: La Direction Nationale de l'Emploi (NDE) au Nigeria lance la phase 2 de son Initiative d'Emploi Renouvelé (RHEI), un programme entièrement financé visant à lutter contre le chômage en offrant des formations techniques, professionnelles et numériques aux jeunes et aux adultes.

details.heading: Formation et Allocation
details.text: Le programme comprend une formation complète, une allocation mensuelle de ₦30,000, un certificat de réussite et un kit de démarrage pour faciliter l'insertion professionnelle ou la création d'entreprise. Des prêts à faible taux d'intérêt sont également disponibles.

details.heading: Critères d'Éligibilité
details.text: Les candidats doivent être des citoyens nigérians âgés de 18 à 45 ans, prêts à apprendre et à travailler ou à créer une entreprise.  Plusieurs catégories de personnes sont éligibles, y compris les jeunes chômeurs, les diplômés, les artisans, les femmes, les personnes handicapées, les agriculteurs, les retraités, etc.

details.heading: Programmes Disponibles
details.text: Le programme propose plusieurs volets de formation : Développement des Compétences Professionnelles (VSD), Petites et Moyennes Entreprises (PME), Promotion de l'Emploi Rural (REP), et Travaux Publics Spéciaux (SPW).

draft_summary.closing: Pour postuler, veuillez cliquer sur le lien fourni. La date limite de candidature est le 11 août 2025.

title: Call For Applications: Federal Ministry of Education BRIDGE Program for Global Academic Collaboration(With Funding and Grants Opportunities )
subtitle: Le programme BRIDGE connecte les universitaires nigérians avec leurs homologues de la diaspora pour favoriser les échanges de connaissances et l'innovation.
description: Cette initiative stratégique vise à améliorer le paysage académique nigérian grâce à l'accès au savoir mondial, à des financements internationaux et à des partenariats significatifs.  Les chercheurs de la diaspora pourront collaborer activement avec des institutions nigérianes.
content: ShareThe Federal Ministry of Education (FME), in collaboration with the Tertiary Education Trust Fund (TETFund), has officially launched BRIDGE—Bridging Research, Innovation, Development & Global Engagement.The portal is now open for applications from interested and qualified individuals.This strategic initiative is designed to connect Nigerian academics and professionals with their counterparts in the diaspora, fostering cross-border knowledge exchange, research advancement, and innovation.According to the Honourable Minister of Education, the BRIDGE program aims to empower the Nigerian academic landscape through increased access to global knowledge, international funding, meaningful partnerships, and modern educational practices.Through BRIDGE, structured opportunities will be created for diaspora scholars to actively collaborate with Nigerian institutions, driving improvements in research, pedagogy, and industry alignment.Why Join BRIDGE?By becoming part of the BRIDGE program, you will:Gain both national and international recognition for your expertiseContribute to high-impact research and industry-relevant projectsMentor and collaborate with Nigerian academics and studentsAccess funding and grant opportunities for joint researchJoin a vibrant network shaping Nigeria’s future through innovation and educationClickHereTo ApplyPost Views:814ShareRelated Posts:Ultimate 2025 Guide to the Top Business Enabling…MSME Africa Unveils Top 50 Remarkable MSME Founders…15 Social Media Management Tools That Will Make Life…How to Apply for Federal Ministry of Education…Call For Applications: Bayer Foundation Women…Overcoming Binding Constraints to Competitive…Tags:The Bridge
meta_title: Programme BRIDGE : Collaboration académique mondiale (Financement disponible)
meta_description: Le Ministère de l'Education du Nigéria lance BRIDGE, un programme de collaboration académique mondiale avec financement et bourses. Candidatures ouvertes !

draft_summary.introduction: Le Ministère fédéral de l'Éducation (FME) du Nigéria, en collaboration avec le Fonds fiduciaire pour l'enseignement supérieur (TETFund), lance BRIDGE (Bridging Research, Innovation, Development & Global Engagement), un programme visant à connecter les universitaires et professionnels nigérians avec leurs homologues de la diaspora pour des collaborations de recherche, des échanges de connaissances et l'innovation.

details.heading: Avantages du programme BRIDGE
details.text: Reconnaissance nationale et internationale, contribution à des recherches de haut impact, mentorat d'étudiants nigérians, accès à des financements et bourses pour la recherche conjointe, intégration à un réseau dynamique.

details.heading: Objectifs du programme
details.text: Renforcer le paysage académique nigérian en améliorant l'accès au savoir mondial, en favorisant des partenariats internationaux et en adoptant des pratiques éducatives modernes.  Créer des opportunités structurées pour les chercheurs de la diaspora de collaborer avec les institutions nigérianes.

draft_summary.closing: Les candidatures sont ouvertes. Pour postuler, veuillez cliquer sur le lien fourni dans l'article.  Pour plus d'informations, contactez le Ministère fédéral de l'Éducation du Nigéria.

title: Call For Applications: World Bank Group GovTech Innovation Challenge 2025 for Early-Stage Startups, Scale-ups, and SMEs
subtitle: Développez des solutions digitales innovantes pour l'administration fiscale du Ghana avec la Banque mondiale et ses partenaires suisses.
description: Les startups, scale-ups et PME sélectionnées participeront à un bootcamp en Suisse, à des visites de terrain et à une conférence GovTech à Genève.  Le challenge vise à améliorer l'efficacité et la transparence de l'administration fiscale ghanéenne.
content: ShareWorld Bank Group GovTech Innovation. Partner with the World Bank to develop digital solutions for Ghana Tax Administration this autumn.RequirementsEarly-stage startups, scale-ups, and SMEs that:Are legally incorporatedHave fewer than 75 employeesHave under $5M USD in annual revenuePossess technical, operational, and business expertise relevant to the challengeHave the capacity to actively participate in challenge activitiesBenefitsSelected companies will be invited to participate in the following activities:4-day GovTech Bootcamp in SwitzerlandA hands-on program designed to foster innovation and collaborationField Visits to Leading InstitutionsInternational Geneva, State of Vaud,EPFL,EPFL Innovation Park,SICPA,SGS,Kudelskiand more.Mentoring & Networking OpportunitiesEngage with domain experts and connect with key stakeholders from the Swiss financial sector.​Workshops on Public Sector CollaborationCovering B2G engagement, regulatory compliance, scalability planning, and proposal refinement across the public and private sectorsShowcase of Top 3 ProposalsFinalists present their innovative solutions to a global audience.Insights from the Innovation ChallengeReflections on key learnings, challenges, and future opportunities.Quantum in Public Administration: Quantum 101An accessible introduction to quantum technologies and their potential impact on government operations.Digital Trust in Public Sector DigitizationExploring frameworks that ensure secure, transparent, and trusted digital transformation.AI in Public AdministrationPanel discussions on cybersecurity, governance, and ethical AI deployment in government.Resource Mobilization, Tax Administration & DigitalTrust:Examining how digital tools are reshaping public finance and trust-building mechanisms.Application TimelineSubmit your proposal: 28 Jul – 12 SepOutline proposed technical approach, implementation methodology, and potential impact to address the tax administration challenge of Ghana Revenue Authority.Information Sessions: 18 Aug- 12 SepQ&A format of online sessions with Ghana Revenue Authority will provide opportunities to clarify technical requirements, discuss implementation approaches and gain deeper insights into the specifics of taxation in Ghana.Pitch Sessions: 15 Sep – 26 SepPresent your proposal to the Selection Committee, which includes representatives from the World Bank, the Swiss Secretariat for Economic Affairs, and Trust Valley partners from Geneva and the Canton of Vaud across the public, private, and academic sectors.Final selection: 3 OctThe Selection Committee will choose Top 3 companies with the best proposals, which will receive comprehensive support to develop their proposals from initial concept to functional Proof of Concept (PoC)GovTech Bootcamp & Conference in Switzerland: 2 DecSelected companies will participate in a 4-day program to build capacity in public-private collaboration and refine their Proof of Concepts with Ghana Revenue Authority and the World BankThe program concludes with the companies presenting their proposed solutions during a dedicated session at the GovTech ConferencePrototyping: 2026Following the Swiss ecosystem experience, selected companies will gain a unique opportunity to implement a pilot solution for the Ghana Revenue AdministrationDeadline: September 12, 2025ClickHEREto ApplyPost Views:234ShareRelated Les entreprises sélectionnées bénéficieront d'un accompagnement intensif en Suisse et de l'opportunité de présenter leurs solutions à un public international.

details.text: Startups, scale-ups et PME légalement constituées, avec moins de 75 employés, un chiffre d'affaires annuel inférieur à 5 millions de dollars US et une expertise technique, opérationnelle et commerciale pertinente.

title: Call For Applications: ELISA Business Scholars Program 2025 for African Entrepreneurs (Fully-funded to Zimbabwe)
subtitle: Le programme ELISA Business Scholars offre une formation intensive de 3 jours, un mentorat d'un an et un accès à un réseau d'experts pour les entrepreneurs africains.
description: Ce programme entièrement financé soutient les entrepreneurs africains à fort potentiel.  Il inclut une formation intensive, un mentorat personnalisé et un accès à un réseau d'affaires étendu.
content: ShareThe 3-day business experience brings together a cohort of high potential entrepreneurs or founders of startups with bold business ideas for various industry sectors across Africa.Each scholar is assigned a business leader as their coach for the one-year ELISA Business Scholars Program. With their coaches, scholars attend an immersive training session led by business experts and industry leaders to advance their ideas, refine their business strategy, and create jobs. ELISA Scholars are trained to manage business financials, develop an investor presentation and elevator pitch. After the training session, ELISA Scholars continue to meet virtually with their coaches once a month for a year to ensure continued refinement and implementation of a business plan. They stay connected using the online ELISA portal.ELISA is an initiative of ICPD, the International Center for Professional Development, a 501c3 non-profit organization based in the United States. The aim of the ELISA Scholars Program is to embolden Africa-focused entrepreneurs and leaders to advance their ideas and create jobs on the continent.EligibilityOpen to applicants of any age, sector or gender who are founders of their ventures.You mustCreate a Profileand login to the ELISA Portal to create yourProject Page.Your business, project or idea should primarily operate in Africa and benefit an African economy.You must live in an African country and have the ability to meet with your coach once per month using WhatsApp, Google Meet or Zoom. Alumni of the ELISA Scholars Program cannot reapply.BenefitsSuccessful applicants receive:2-day training session and conference materialsOne year of mentoring from a business coachConference accommodations and mealsFlights booked for you or travel costs reimbursedAccess to business leaders & the ELISA Business SummitLifetime membership to the ELISA business network and virtual eventsUnlimited access to entrepreneurial contentDeadline: August 31, 2025ClickHEREto ApplyPost Views:136ShareRelated Posts:Call For Proposals: Nigeria Soot-free Bus…Ultimate 2025 Guide to the Top Business Enabling…MSME Africa Unveils Top 50 Remarkable MSME Founders…How African Startups Can Secure Funding in Tough MarketsOvercoming Binding Constraints to Competitive…15 Social Media Management Tools That Will Make Life…Tags:Call for ApplicationsELISA Business Scholars Program 2025 for African EntrepreneursEntrepreneursFully-funded to ZimbabweMSME AfricaOpportunities

details.text: Une session de formation immersive de 3 jours avec des experts et des leaders de l'industrie, axée sur le perfectionnement des stratégies d'affaires, la gestion financière et la création de présentations pour les investisseurs.
